content.$t: headline: North Korea's nuclear ambitions, text: North Korea has described itself as a "nuclear weapons state both in name and reality" and experts warn that by 2020 it could have anywhere from 20 to 100 weapons capable of hitting its neighbors or even the United States. How did we get here? , mediacredit: AP, type: title, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151010115216-05-north-korea-military-parade-exlarge-169.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea has described itself as a "nuclear weapons state both in name and reality" and experts warn that by 2020 it could have anywhere from 20 to 100 weapons capable of hitting its neighbors or even the United States. How did we get here?

content.$t: month: 12, day: 12, headline: North Korea joins the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT), text: Pyongyang ratifies the United Nations Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, but does not bring itself into compliance. North Korea would fully withdraw from the Treaty in 2003., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106103525-01-nk-timeline-iaea-background.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea joins the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT)

gsx$text.$t: Pyongyang ratifies the United Nations Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, but does not bring itself into compliance. North Korea would fully withdraw from the Treaty in 2003.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 1, endyear: 1993, endmonth: 12, endday: 31, displaydate: 1993, headline: Early warnings over North Korea's nuclear weapons program, text: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) accuses North Korea of violating the NPT, leading Pyongyang to threaten withdrawl but ultimately to agree to allow inspectors. , background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106103525-01-nk-timeline-iaea-background.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Early warnings over North Korea's nuclear weapons program

gsx$text.$t: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) accuses North Korea of violating the NPT, leading Pyongyang to threaten withdrawl but ultimately to agree to allow inspectors.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 21, headline: U.S. and North Korea sign agreement, text: North Korea pledges to freeze and eventually dismantle its nuclear weapons program in exchange for international aid to build two nuclear power stations., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130410120126-dmz-border-c1-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: Scot Clotworthy, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: U.S. and North Korea sign agreement

gsx$text.$t: North Korea pledges to freeze and eventually dismantle its nuclear weapons program in exchange for international aid to build two nuclear power stations.

content.$t: month: 11, day: 17, headline: Pyongyang talks, text: The U.S. and North Korea hold high-level talks in Pyongyang, with the Americans demanding to inspect an underground facility believed to be being used to develop nuclear weapons., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/131217000909-pyongyang-kim-statues-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The U.S. and North Korea hold high-level talks in Pyongyang, with the Americans demanding to inspect an underground facility believed to be being used to develop nuclear weapons.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 27, endyear: 1999, endmonth: 3, endday: 16, headline: Inspections take place, text: During a fourth round of talks, North Korea allows U.S. access to the site in exchange for U.S. aid in increasing North Korean potato yields. U.S. inspectors find no evidence of any nuclear activity during a visit to the site in May., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: During a fourth round of talks, North Korea allows U.S. access to the site in exchange for U.S. aid in increasing North Korean potato yields. U.S. inspectors find no evidence of any nuclear activity during a visit to the site in May.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 13, endyear: 1999, endmonth: 9, endday: 17, headline: Testing stops, sanctions lifted, text: North Korea agrees to freeze testing of long-range missiles while negotiations with the U.S. continue. President Bill Clinton agrees to ease economic sanctions against North Korea., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106115050-bill-clinton-archive-2005-exlarge-169.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea agrees to freeze testing of long-range missiles while negotiations with the U.S. continue. President Bill Clinton agrees to ease economic sanctions against North Korea.

content.$t: month: 5, displaydate: June, 2001, headline: Pyongyang threatens to resume missile tests, text: North Korea warns it will drop its moratorium against testing missiles if the U.S. does not pursue normalized relations with North Korea., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Pyongyang threatens to resume missile tests

gsx$text.$t: North Korea warns it will drop its moratorium against testing missiles if the U.S. does not pursue normalized relations with North Korea.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 29, headline: Axis of Evil, text: President George W. Bush labels North Korea, Iran and Iraq an "axis of evil" in his State of the Union address. "By seeking weapons of mass destruction, these regimes pose a grave and growing danger," he says., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120144705-george-w-bush-state-of-the-union-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: President George W. Bush labels North Korea, Iran and Iraq an "axis of evil" in his State of the Union address. "By seeking weapons of mass destruction, these regimes pose a grave and growing danger," he says.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 16, headline: Secret nuclear weapons program, text: The Bush Administration first reveals that North Korea has admitted operating a secret nuclear weapons program in violation of the 1994 agreement. It is unclear whether Pyongyang has any completed nuclear weapons., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The Bush Administration first reveals that North Korea has admitted operating a secret nuclear weapons program in violation of the 1994 agreement. It is unclear whether Pyongyang has any completed nuclear weapons.

content.$t: month: 12, day: 22, endyear: 2002, endmonth: 12, endday: 31, headline: Inspectors expelled, text: North Korea removes IAEA monitoring equipment from its nuclear facilities and expels inspectors., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106103525-01-nk-timeline-iaea-background-story-top.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea removes IAEA monitoring equipment from its nuclear facilities and expels inspectors.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 10, endyear: 2003, endmonth: 2, endday: 26, headline: Withdrawal from the NPT, text: North Korea officially withdraws from the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty and reactivates its nuclear facilities. , background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea officially withdraws from the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty and reactivates its nuclear facilities.

content.$t: month: 4, day: 23, endyear: 2003, endmonth: 4, endday: 27, headline: North Korea says it has a nuclear weapon, text: Pyongyang declares it has nuclear weapons, prompting crisis talks between the U.S., North Korea, South Korea, China, Japan and Russia. , background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea says it has a nuclear weapon

gsx$text.$t: Pyongyang declares it has nuclear weapons, prompting crisis talks between the U.S., North Korea, South Korea, China, Japan and Russia.

content.$t: month: 8, day: 27, endyear: 2004, endmonth: 2, endday: 28, headline: First series of six-party talks, text: The U.S., North Korea, South Korea, China, Japan and Russia meet in Beijing, China for more talks. The summit closes with no major progress but with an agreement for more talks., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120162139-six-party-talks-north-korea-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The U.S., North Korea, South Korea, China, Japan and Russia meet in Beijing, China for more talks. The summit closes with no major progress but with an agreement for more talks.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 28, endyear: 2004, endmonth: 8, headline: Talks continue, text: The six nations meet for more talks, with North Korea eventually agreeing to freeze its nuclear program in exchange for aid, easing of sanctions and being removed from the U.S.' list of state sponsors of terrorism. The U.S. wants North Korea to disclose all nuclear activities and allow inspections., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120162139-six-party-talks-north-korea-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The six nations meet for more talks, with North Korea eventually agreeing to freeze its nuclear program in exchange for aid, easing of sanctions and being removed from the U.S.' list of state sponsors of terrorism. The U.S. wants North Korea to disclose all nuclear activities and allow inspections.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 10, headline: North Korea drops out of talks, text: Pyongyang drops out of six-party nuclear talks and says it will bolster its nuclear weapons arsenal. North Korea insists on a bilateral non-aggression pact with the U.S. before it will consider dismantling its nuclear program. The U.S. insists Pyongyang must first agree to permanently and verifiably dismantle its nuclear weapons program before it will grant any incentives, including economic assistance and diplomatic recognition., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea drops out of talks

gsx$text.$t: Pyongyang drops out of six-party nuclear talks and says it will bolster its nuclear weapons arsenal. North Korea insists on a bilateral non-aggression pact with the U.S. before it will consider dismantling its nuclear program. The U.S. insists Pyongyang must first agree to permanently and verifiably dismantle its nuclear weapons program before it will grant any incentives, including economic assistance and diplomatic recognition.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 13, endyear: 2005, endmonth: 9, endday: 19, headline: Talks resume, text: North Korea returns to the negotiating table, eventually agreeing to give up its entire nuclear program. Pyongyang releases a statement committing itself to "abandoning all nuclear weapons and existing nuclear programs.", background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea returns to the negotiating table, eventually agreeing to give up its entire nuclear program. Pyongyang releases a statement committing itself to "abandoning all nuclear weapons and existing nuclear programs."

content.$t: month: 9, day: 20, headline: Never mind, text: North Korean officials say that their country would begin dismantling its nuclear program only if the U.S. provides a light-water reactor for civilian power. "Without this physical guarantee of the (light-water reactor), our position is not to even dream of us giving up our nuclear deterrence.", background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korean officials say that their country would begin dismantling its nuclear program only if the U.S. provides a light-water reactor for civilian power. "Without this physical guarantee of the (light-water reactor), our position is not to even dream of us giving up our nuclear deterrence."

content.$t: month: 7, day: 4, headline: Taepodong-2 missile test, text: North Korea test-launches a Taepodong-2 missile along with two short-range rockets, but the long-range missile apparently fails., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130404150350-north-korea-missile-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea test-launches a Taepodong-2 missile along with two short-range rockets, but the long-range missile apparently fails.

content.$t: month: 7, day: 15, headline: U.N. Security Council resolution passed, text: The U.N. Security Council unanimously passes a resolution demanding that North Korea suspend its missile program. The North Korean ambassador immediately rejects the resolution., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151217094810-un-building-flags-flying-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The U.N. Security Council unanimously passes a resolution demanding that North Korea suspend its missile program. The North Korean ambassador immediately rejects the resolution.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 9, headline: FIRST NUCLEAR TEST, text: North Korea says that it has successfully tested a nuclear weapon at an underground facility in Hwaderi near Kilju city. South Korea reports detecting an artificial earthquake in the region of the test and later analysis of air samples reveal radioactive debris, confirming Pyongyang's claims. , media: https://www.google.com.hk/maps/place/Kilju,+North+Hamgyong,+North+Korea/@40.9620658,129.3073195,5649m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m2!3m1!1s0x5fce9121ab8514a3:0x24e08fb0f02939ca!6m1!1e1, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea says that it has successfully tested a nuclear weapon at an underground facility in Hwaderi near Kilju city. South Korea reports detecting an artificial earthquake in the region of the test and later analysis of air samples reveal radioactive debris, confirming Pyongyang's claims.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 13, headline: Back to the negotiating table, text: North Korea agrees to close its main nuclear reactor in exchange for an aid package worth $400 million., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea agrees to close its main nuclear reactor in exchange for an aid package worth $400 million.

content.$t: month: 6, day: 25, endyear: 2007, endmonth: 9, endday: 2, headline: North Korea "reaffirms" commitment to nuclear disarmament, text: U.S. envoy to North Korea Chris Hill says that North Korea has reaffirmed its commitment to the nuclear disarmament agreement reached in February and will allow IAEA inspectors back into the country. He later announces that Pyongyang has agreed to fully declare and disable its nuclear programs by the end of 2007., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106120014-chris-hill-north-korea-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea "reaffirms" commitment to nuclear disarmament

gsx$text.$t: U.S. envoy to North Korea Chris Hill says that North Korea has reaffirmed its commitment to the nuclear disarmament agreement reached in February and will allow IAEA inspectors back into the country. He later announces that Pyongyang has agreed to fully declare and disable its nuclear programs by the end of 2007.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 30, headline: Six-party talks resume, text: At six-party talks in Beijing, North Korea signs an agreement stating it will begin disabling its nuclear weapons facilities. North Korea also agrees to include a U.S. team of technical experts in the disabling activities., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120162139-six-party-talks-north-korea-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: At six-party talks in Beijing, North Korea signs an agreement stating it will begin disabling its nuclear weapons facilities. North Korea also agrees to include a U.S. team of technical experts in the disabling activities.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 2, endyear: 2007, endmonth: 10, endday: 4, headline: North and South Korean leaders meet, text: South Korean President Roh Moo-hyun becomes the first South Korean leader to walk across the Demilitarized Zone separating North and South Korea on his way to a three-day summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Il. Kim signs an agreement committing to demilitarization and replacing the current armistice agreement with a permanent peace treaty., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120162846-roo-kim-korea-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North and South Korean leaders meet

gsx$text.$t: South Korean President Roh Moo-hyun becomes the first South Korean leader to walk across the Demilitarized Zone separating North and South Korea on his way to a three-day summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Il. Kim signs an agreement committing to demilitarization and replacing the current armistice agreement with a permanent peace treaty.

content.$t: month: 12, day: 31, headline: Deadline? What deadline?, text: North Korea misses a deadline to declare all its nuclear programs, later claiming that it had already provided enough information to satisfy the requirements agreed upon in the six-party talks, a point disputed by other signatories. , background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea misses a deadline to declare all its nuclear programs, later claiming that it had already provided enough information to satisfy the requirements agreed upon in the six-party talks, a point disputed by other signatories.

content.$t: month: 5, day: 8, endyear: 2008, endmonth: 6, endday: 27, headline: Progress, text: North Korea hands over thousands of documents pertaining to its nuclear activities, especially related to its production of plutonium, to visiting U.S. official Sohn Kim. In a symbolic gesture, a water cooling tower at the Yongbyon nuclear facility is also destroyed. , background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea hands over thousands of documents pertaining to its nuclear activities, especially related to its production of plutonium, to visiting U.S. official Sohn Kim. In a symbolic gesture, a water cooling tower at the Yongbyon nuclear facility is also destroyed.

content.$t: month: 12, day: 8, endyear: 2008, endmonth: 12, endday: 11, headline: More talks, text: Another round of six-party talks is held in Beijing, China. The talks break down over North Korea's refusal to allow international inspectors unfettered access to suspected nuclear sites., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120162139-six-party-talks-north-korea-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Another round of six-party talks is held in Beijing, China. The talks break down over North Korea's refusal to allow international inspectors unfettered access to suspected nuclear sites.

content.$t: month: 1, headline: Most of North Korea's plutonium stockpile 'weaponized', text: U.S. scholar Selig Harrison meets with senior officials in North Korea. After the meeting he reports that the officials have claimed that North Korea has weaponized most of its plutonium stockpile. The amount of weaponized plutonium is allegedly enough for four to five nuclear bombs., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Most of North Korea's plutonium stockpile 'weaponized'

gsx$text.$t: U.S. scholar Selig Harrison meets with senior officials in North Korea. After the meeting he reports that the officials have claimed that North Korea has weaponized most of its plutonium stockpile. The amount of weaponized plutonium is allegedly enough for four to five nuclear bombs.

content.$t: month: 5, day: 25, headline: SECOND NUCLEAR TEST, text: North Korea announces it has conducted its second nuclear test shortly after the U.S. Geological Survey reports a magnitude 4.7 seismic disturbance at the site of North Korea's first nuclear test. The White House reports that North Korea also test-fired a short range missile., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130131014107-north-korea-nuclear-test-site-2-story-top.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea announces it has conducted its second nuclear test shortly after the U.S. Geological Survey reports a magnitude 4.7 seismic disturbance at the site of North Korea's first nuclear test. The White House reports that North Korea also test-fired a short range missile.

content.$t: month: 6, day: 12, headline: Sanctions and condemnations, text: The UN Security Council approves Resolution 1874, condemning North Korea's May 25th nuclear test. The UN also imposes new sanctions, banning the sale of most arms to or from North Korea., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106120537-security-council-2009-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The UN Security Council approves Resolution 1874, condemning North Korea's May 25th nuclear test. The UN also imposes new sanctions, banning the sale of most arms to or from North Korea.

content.$t: month: 11, day: 20, headline: New facility, text: According to a report by Stanford University professor Siegfried Hecker, North Korea has a new nuclear enrichment facility composed of 2,000 centrifuges. Hecker was given unprecedented access to North Korea's facility and documents., media: http://edition.cnn.com/video/world/2010/11/23/intv.dougherty.hecker.korea.cnn.640x360.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: According to a report by Stanford University professor Siegfried Hecker, North Korea has a new nuclear enrichment facility composed of 2,000 centrifuges. Hecker was given unprecedented access to North Korea's facility and documents.

content.$t: month: 12, day: 17, headline: KIM JONG IL DIES, text: Kim Jong Il dies aged 69 (or 70), reportedly of a heart attack. According to the KCNA state news agency, during his death a fierce snowstorm paused and the sky glowed red above Mount Paktu. His son, Kim Jong Un, succeeds him as leader., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/111228111621-hancocks-north-korea-kim-jong-il-funeral-00010417.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Kim Jong Il dies aged 69 (or 70), reportedly of a heart attack. According to the KCNA state news agency, during his death a fierce snowstorm paused and the sky glowed red above Mount Paktu. His son, Kim Jong Un, succeeds him as leader.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 29, headline: Missile moratorium, text: The U.S. State Department announces that North Korea has agreed to a moratorium on long-range missile launches and nuclear activity at Yongbyon, the nation's major nuclear facility., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The U.S. State Department announces that North Korea has agreed to a moratorium on long-range missile launches and nuclear activity at Yongbyon, the nation's major nuclear facility.

content.$t: month: 4, day: 13, headline: Long-range rocket test fails, text: North Korea's long-range rocket launch is a failure. Shortly after launch, it breaks apart and falls into the sea. Japan, South Korea and the U.S. believe the purported space program to be a cover-up for testing a long-range ballistic missile., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120163423-north-korea-rocket-test-fail-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea's long-range rocket launch is a failure. Shortly after launch, it breaks apart and falls into the sea. Japan, South Korea and the U.S. believe the purported space program to be a cover-up for testing a long-range ballistic missile.

content.$t: month: 12, day: 12, headline: Satellite launch, text: North Korea successfully launches an Unha-3 long-range rocket from the Sohae Space Center in Cholsan County and puts a "working satellite" into orbit, days after Pyongyang suggested the launch could be delayed., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/121213082339-02-nk-missile-1213-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea successfully launches an Unha-3 long-range rocket from the Sohae Space Center in Cholsan County and puts a "working satellite" into orbit, days after Pyongyang suggested the launch could be delayed.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 24, headline: Sworn enemies, text: North Korea's National Defense Commission says it will continue nuclear testing and long-range rocket launches, all of which are a part of an "upcoming all-out action" aimed at the United States, "the sworn enemy of the Korean people.", background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea's National Defense Commission says it will continue nuclear testing and long-range rocket launches, all of which are a part of an "upcoming all-out action" aimed at the United States, "the sworn enemy of the Korean people."

content.$t: month: 2, day: 12, headline: THIRD NUCLEAR TEST, text: North Korea conducts its third underground nuclear test. This is the first nuclear test carried out under leader Kim Jong Un., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106112538-north-korea-nuclear-test-site-story-top.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea conducts its third underground nuclear test. This is the first nuclear test carried out under leader Kim Jong Un.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 2, headline: More talks?, text: A senior North Korean envoy says the country is ready to resume the six-party talks regarding its nuclear program. , background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: A senior North Korean envoy says the country is ready to resume the six-party talks regarding its nuclear program.

content.$t: month: 5, day: 6, headline: Capable of striking U.S. mainland, text: Park Yong Chol, deputy director of the DPRK Institute for Research into National Reunification, tells CNN in an exclusive interview that his country has the missile capability to strike mainland United States and would do so if the U.S. "forced their hand.", media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/150507113801-ripley-park-yong-choo-1-exlarge-169.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Park Yong Chol, deputy director of the DPRK Institute for Research into National Reunification, tells CNN in an exclusive interview that his country has the missile capability to strike mainland United States and would do so if the U.S. "forced their hand."

content.$t: month: 5, day: 9, headline: Submarine missile test, text: The North Korean state news agency reports that the country has carried out a successful underwater test of a ballistic missile by launching it from a submarine., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/150508215003-north-korea-submarine-missile-test-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: The North Korean state news agency reports that the country has carried out a successful underwater test of a ballistic missile by launching it from a submarine.

content.$t: month: 5, day: 20, headline: Moving towards ICBMs?, text: North Korea says that it has the ability to miniaturize nuclear weapons, a key step toward building nuclear missiles. A U.S. National Security Council spokesman responds that the U.S. does not think the North Koreans have that capability., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/150915132414-north-korea-replica-missiles-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea says that it has the ability to miniaturize nuclear weapons, a key step toward building nuclear missiles. A U.S. National Security Council spokesman responds that the U.S. does not think the North Koreans have that capability.

content.$t: month: 6, day: 21, headline: No interest in Iran style talks, text: North Korea says it has no interest in Iran-style talks after an agreement reached between Tehran and Western powers. North Korea's nuclear deterrent is "not a plaything to be put on the negotiating table, as it is the essential means to protect its sovereignty and vital rights from the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy which have lasted for more than half a century," an official says., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: No interest in Iran style talks

gsx$text.$t: North Korea says it has no interest in Iran-style talks after an agreement reached between Tehran and Western powers. North Korea's nuclear deterrent is "not a plaything to be put on the negotiating table, as it is the essential means to protect its sovereignty and vital rights from the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy which have lasted for more than half a century," an official says.

content.$t: month: 8, day: 12, headline: Report claims North Korea has new uranium enrichment facility, text: Analysts say satellite imagery indicates that a second hall housing active centrifuges used for uranium enrichment has been opened at the Yongbyon nuclear site., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151120163858-ihs-north-korea-centrifuge-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: IHS, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Report claims North Korea has new uranium enrichment facility

gsx$text.$t: Analysts say satellite imagery indicates that a second hall housing active centrifuges used for uranium enrichment has been opened at the Yongbyon nuclear site.

content.$t: month: 8, day: 15, endyear: 2015, endmonth: 8, endday: 24, headline: High tensions on the Korean peninsula, text: North and South Korea reach an agreement after a series of flashpoints bring military tensions on the peninsula to their highest point in years, including landmine blasts, loudspeakers blaring propaganda, an exchange of artillery fire and threats of more hostilities. North Korea agrees to lift a "semi-war state" declared during the emergency., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130309110325-02-north-korea-0309-horizontal-large-gallery.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: High tensions on the Korean peninsula

gsx$text.$t: North and South Korea reach an agreement after a series of flashpoints bring military tensions on the peninsula to their highest point in years, including landmine blasts, loudspeakers blaring propaganda, an exchange of artillery fire and threats of more hostilities. North Korea agrees to lift a "semi-war state" declared during the emergency.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 15, headline: Ready to use nuclear weapons at 'any time', text: A North Korean senior atomic energy official says the country is ready to attack the U.S. with nuclear weapons at "any time", adding that its nuclear arsenal has imrpoved both "in quality and quantity"., media: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRPjIVKWmSg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Ready to use nuclear weapons at 'any time'

gsx$text.$t: A North Korean senior atomic energy official says the country is ready to attack the U.S. with nuclear weapons at "any time", adding that its nuclear arsenal has imrpoved both "in quality and quantity".

content.$t: month: 9, day: 16, headline: Sanctions 'not enough', text: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry warns that North Korea must not be allowed to become a nuclear weapons state, even if it takes more than sanctions to convince them., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/140213182216-john-kerry---s030922385-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry warns that North Korea must not be allowed to become a nuclear weapons state, even if it takes more than sanctions to convince them.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 9, headline: Preparations for fourth test underway, text: U.S. officials tell CNN that there are "indications" that North Korea is preparing for a major weapons test, likely a submarine-launched medium-range ballistic missile., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: U.S. officials tell CNN that there are "indications" that North Korea is preparing for a major weapons test, likely a submarine-launched medium-range ballistic missile.

content.$t: month: 10, day: 10, headline: Huge military parade, text: North Korea holds a huge military parade to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the ruling Workers' Party, during which Kim Jong Un says his country is "fully ready" to defend itself against any U.S. threat. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/151010114808-02-north-korea-military-parade-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: AP, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea holds a huge military parade to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the ruling Workers' Party, during which Kim Jong Un says his country is "fully ready" to defend itself against any U.S. threat.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 6, headline: HYDROGEN BOMB TEST, text: North Korea claims that it successfully tested a thermonuclear device, a marked increase in its nuclear capabilities. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2016/images/01/06/nk-missile-ranges-large.jpg, mediacredit: CNN, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106112008-north-korea-earthquake-story-top.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea claims that it successfully tested a thermonuclear device, a marked increase in its nuclear capabilities.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 8, headline: K-Pop assault, text: Following North Korea's claims that it tested a hydrogen bomb, South Korea resumes loudspeaker broadcasts across the DMZ, blasting pop music, news reports and other information into the isolated country. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160108094245-south-korea-propaganda-hancocks-pkg-00000415-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: YG Entertainment, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Following North Korea's claims that it tested a hydrogen bomb, South Korea resumes loudspeaker broadcasts across the DMZ, blasting pop music, news reports and other information into the isolated country.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 10, headline: B-52 flyover, text: Days after the purported North Korean nuclear test, the U.S. flies a B-52 bomber jet over Osan, South Korea in "response" to Pyongyang's claims. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160110044819-north-korea-h-bomb-b-52-fly-over-hancocks-lok-00005628-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: U.S. Pacific Command, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Days after the purported North Korean nuclear test, the U.S. flies a B-52 bomber jet over Osan, South Korea in "response" to Pyongyang's claims.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 27, headline: John Kerry visits Beijing, text: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry calls on China to step up pressure on North Korea after its recent nuclear test., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160127171008-china-kerry-wang-yi-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry calls on China to step up pressure on North Korea after its recent nuclear test.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 28, headline: Concerns over potential rocket launch, text: Footage from U.S. spy satellites sparks concerns North Korea may be preparing for a rocket launch., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160107142042-north-korea-missile-taepodong-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Footage from U.S. spy satellites sparks concerns North Korea may be preparing for a rocket launch.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 7, headline: Launch of 'missile', text: North Korea launches a long-range "missile," according to South Korean defense ministry officials, in defiance of U.N. sanctions and warnings from neighboring nations., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160206164310-north-korea-rocket-launch-satellite-hancocks-orig-00011106-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea launches a long-range "missile," according to South Korean defense ministry officials, in defiance of U.N. sanctions and warnings from neighboring nations.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 11, headline: South Korean workers leave Kaesong industrial park, text: The South Korean Unification Ministry said 280 workers who had been stationed at the Kaesong industrial complex had crossed the military demarcation line and were back on South Korean soil., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160212101757-south-korea-anti-kim-jong-un-demo-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: South Korean workers leave Kaesong industrial park

gsx$text.$t: The South Korean Unification Ministry said 280 workers who had been stationed at the Kaesong industrial complex had crossed the military demarcation line and were back on South Korean soil.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 22, headline: North Korea offered -- then rebuffed -- talks with U.S., text: North Korea quietly reached out to U.S. officials in 2015 to propose formal peace talks on ending the Korean War, senior U.S. officials told CNN. That effort fell short after the North Koreans refused to include their nuclear program in any negotiations., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160222185304-north-korea-new-general-kim-jong-un-todd-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea offered -- then rebuffed -- talks with U.S.

gsx$text.$t: North Korea quietly reached out to U.S. officials in 2015 to propose formal peace talks on ending the Korean War, senior U.S. officials told CNN. That effort fell short after the North Koreans refused to include their nuclear program in any negotiations.

content.$t: month: 3, day: 2, headline: U.N. hits North Korea with hardest ever sanctions, text: The United Nations Security Council votes to impose a broad array of sanctions against North Korea because of that nation's recent nuclear test and missile launch -- both of which defied current international sanctions., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160302113619-un-security-council-slaps-new-sanctions-north-korea-richard-roth-00005517-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: CNN, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: U.N. hits North Korea with hardest ever sanctions

gsx$text.$t: The United Nations Security Council votes to impose a broad array of sanctions against North Korea because of that nation's recent nuclear test and missile launch -- both of which defied current international sanctions.

content.$t: month: 3, day: 3, headline: "Nuclear warheads need to be ready for use at any time", text: After new U.N. sanctions are passed, Kim Jong Un says the "only way for our people to protect sovereignty and rights to live is to strengthen the quality and quantity of nuclear power.", media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160303180511-north-korea-missiles-un-sanctions-todd-dnt-tsr-00000915-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: "Nuclear warheads need to be ready for use at any time"

gsx$text.$t: After new U.N. sanctions are passed, Kim Jong Un says the "only way for our people to protect sovereignty and rights to live is to strengthen the quality and quantity of nuclear power."

content.$t: month: 3, day: 9, headline: North Korea claims to have miniaturized nuclear warheads, text: KCNA reports that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met with nuclear scientists and technicians who briefed him on "research conducted to tip various type tactical and strategic ballistic missiles with nuclear warheads.", media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160309123224-north-korea-warhead-1-resize-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: Rodong Shimbun, mediacaption: KCNA claims that Kim has visited a facility where warheads had been made to fit on ballistic missiles., background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea claims to have miniaturized nuclear warheads

gsx$text.$t: KCNA reports that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met with nuclear scientists and technicians who briefed him on "research conducted to tip various type tactical and strategic ballistic missiles with nuclear warheads."

gsx$mediacaption.$t: KCNA claims that Kim has visited a facility where warheads had been made to fit on ballistic missiles.

content.$t: month: 3, day: 10, headline: North Korea fires two short-range missiles, text: North Korea fires two short-range ballistic missiles from North Hwanghae province, south of Pyongyang, as the U.S. and South Korean militaries conduct their "largest ever" joint exercises. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/141110102732-north-korea-soldier-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea fires two short-range missiles

gsx$text.$t: North Korea fires two short-range ballistic missiles from North Hwanghae province, south of Pyongyang, as the U.S. and South Korean militaries conduct their "largest ever" joint exercises.

content.$t: month: 3, day: 14, headline: North Korea to test nuclear warhead, state media reports, text: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un orders tests of a nuclear warhead in the "nearest future," state-run news agency KCNA reports., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160315150104-ballistic-testing-bigger-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea to test nuclear warhead, state media reports

gsx$text.$t: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un orders tests of a nuclear warhead in the "nearest future," state-run news agency KCNA reports.

content.$t: month: 3, day: 17, headline: North Korea requests meeting with U.N. Security Council, text: The North Korean ambassador to the U.N. files a request for the body's Security Council to meet over the ongoing U.S.-South Korean joint military exercises., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160312140611-south-korea-military-drills-5-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: KJ Kwon/CNN, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea requests meeting with U.N. Security Council

gsx$text.$t: The North Korean ambassador to the U.N. files a request for the body's Security Council to meet over the ongoing U.S.-South Korean joint military exercises.

content.$t: month: 4, day: 12, headline: Signs of North Korea mobile ballistic missile launch, text: U.S. intelligence satellites spot signs that North Korea may be preparing for an unprecedented launch of a mobile ballistic missile which could potentially hit portions of the U.S., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160207000409-north-korea-launch-2-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: KCTV, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Signs of North Korea mobile ballistic missile launch

gsx$text.$t: U.S. intelligence satellites spot signs that North Korea may be preparing for an unprecedented launch of a mobile ballistic missile which could potentially hit portions of the U.S.

content.$t: month: 4, day: 15, headline: Birthday launch fails, text: Attempts to fire a missile -- reportedly a medium-range Musudan-type -- on the birthday of North Korea's founder, Kim Il Sung end in failure, according to South Korean and U.S. officials., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/150415022021-kim-il-sung-file-super-169.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Attempts to fire a missile -- reportedly a medium-range Musudan-type -- on the birthday of North Korea's founder, Kim Il Sung end in failure, according to South Korean and U.S. officials.

content.$t: month: 4, day: 25, headline: Missile launched from submarine, text: North Korea's firing of a submarine-launched ballistic missile sparks sharp condemnation and concern from officials around the globe., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160424072155-north-korea-missile-launch-sub-confirmed-hancocks-nr-00002404-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea's firing of a submarine-launched ballistic missile sparks sharp condemnation and concern from officials around the globe.

content.$t: month: 4, day: 25, headline: Twin missile tests both fail, text: North Korea fires two midrange Musudan missiles, but both appear to fail, according to the South Korean Defense Ministry official., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160312140611-south-korea-military-drills-5-exlarge-169.jpg, mediacredit: KJ Kwon/CNN, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130518052242-north-korea-missiles-super-169.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea fires two midrange Musudan missiles, but both appear to fail, according to the South Korean Defense Ministry official.

content.$t: month: 5, day: 31, headline: Medium-range missile launch fails, text: An attempted missile launch is assumed to have failed, according to South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff, the latest in a string of failed mid-range-missile launches. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130418141942-north-korea-missile-story-top.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: An attempted missile launch is assumed to have failed, according to South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff, the latest in a string of failed mid-range-missile launches.

content.$t: month: 7, day: 22, headline: Two more missiles, text: Two missiles -- believed to be intermediate-range Musudan missiles -- are launched from Wonson on North Korea's east coast, according to South Korea., media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106111935-kim-jong-un-walks-story-top.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130518052242-north-korea-missiles-super-169.jpg

gsx$text.$t: Two missiles -- believed to be intermediate-range Musudan missiles -- are launched from Wonson on North Korea's east coast, according to South Korea.

content.$t: month: 8, day: 2, headline: Ballistic missile test, text: North Korea fires a ballistic missile from an area in the country's southwest, the second such launch after South Korea deploys the advanced U.S. THAAD missile defense system., media: http://i.cdn.turner.com/cnn/.e/interactive/html5-video-media/2016/07/13/THAAD_infographic_medium.jpg, mediacredit: CNN, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea fires a ballistic missile from an area in the country's southwest, the second such launch after South Korea deploys the advanced U.S. THAAD missile defense system.

content.$t: month: 8, day: 24, headline: Sub missile test, text: North Korea tests a submarine-based ballistic missile from the waters off Sinpo, in South Hamgyong Province. US Pacific Command says it tracked the missile over and into the Sea of Japan, approximately 300 miles off the coast of North Korea. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160424111037-north-korea-slbm-test-overlay-tease.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/130518052242-north-korea-missiles-super-169.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea tests a submarine-based ballistic missile from the waters off Sinpo, in South Hamgyong Province. US Pacific Command says it tracked the missile over and into the Sea of Japan, approximately 300 miles off the coast of North Korea.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 5, headline: Triple missile test, text: North Korea fires three missiles from areas around Hwangju county, in North Hwanghae province, toward the Sea of Japan, South Korea's military said. Japan says they entered its air defense identification zone. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160825122650-0825-north-korea-sub-missile-03-large-tease.jpg, mediacredit: Rodong Shimbun, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea fires three missiles from areas around Hwangju county, in North Hwanghae province, toward the Sea of Japan, South Korea's military said. Japan says they entered its air defense identification zone.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 10, headline: FIFTH NUCLEAR TEST, text: North Korea says it hit the button on its fifth and potentially most powerful nuclear test, claiming to have successfully detonated a nuclear warhead that could be mounted on ballistic rockets., media: http://i.cdn.turner.com/cnn/.e/interactive/html5-video-media/2016/09/09/nuclear_bombs_and_tests_desktop.jpg, mediacredit: CNN, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160106112538-north-korea-nuclear-test-site-story-top.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea says it hit the button on its fifth and potentially most powerful nuclear test, claiming to have successfully detonated a nuclear warhead that could be mounted on ballistic rockets.

content.$t: month: 9, day: 12, headline: Seoul prepares for 'worst case scenario', text: South Korea warns Pyongyang is preparing for a sixth nuclear test, and announces that South Korean military forces are preparing to "punish and retaliate" against North Korea's leadership if it threatens the country with nuclear weapons. , media: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160912110509-south-korea-protest-kim-jong-un-overlay-tease.jpg, mediacredit: Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: South Korea warns Pyongyang is preparing for a sixth nuclear test, and announces that South Korean military forces are preparing to "punish and retaliate" against North Korea's leadership if it threatens the country with nuclear weapons.

content.$t: month: 11, day: 30, headline: Toughest UN sanctions yet to cost North Korea $800 million, text: The UN Security Council votes unanimously for stricter measures against North Korea nearly three months after the secretive nation carried out its fifth nuclear test., media: http://i2.cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/161229103150-kim-jong-un-1228-super-tease.jpg, mediacredit: AFP/Getty, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Toughest UN sanctions yet to cost North Korea $800 million

gsx$text.$t: The UN Security Council votes unanimously for stricter measures against North Korea nearly three months after the secretive nation carried out its fifth nuclear test.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 1, headline: Kim Jong Un says North Korea close to testing ICBM, text: "Research and development of the cutting-edge tech weapons are actively progressing and strengthening our defense capabilities, including last stage preparation of tests for intercontinental ballistic rocket launch have been continuously succeeding," Kim says in a televised address on New Year's Day., media: http://i2.cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/170101021825-north-korea-kim-jong-un-icbm-mohsin-lok-00001024-large-tease.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: Kim Jong Un says North Korea close to testing ICBM

gsx$text.$t: "Research and development of the cutting-edge tech weapons are actively progressing and strengthening our defense capabilities, including last stage preparation of tests for intercontinental ballistic rocket launch have been continuously succeeding," Kim says in a televised address on New Year's Day.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 2, headline: Trump says it 'won't happen', text: "North Korea just stated that it is in the final stages of developing a nuclear weapon capable of reaching parts of the U.S. It won't happen!" Trump tweets., media: http://i2.cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/161213150939-trump-kim-jong-un-split-amanpour-overlay-tease.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: "North Korea just stated that it is in the final stages of developing a nuclear weapon capable of reaching parts of the U.S. It won't happen!" Trump tweets.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 11, headline: Pyongyang signals to Trump, text: North Korea says it could launch an intercontinental ballistic missile "at any time," even as Pyongyang appeared to offer Donald Trump an avenue for future talks., media: http://i2.cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/170109135700-kim-jong-un-20170101-super-tease.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$text.$t: North Korea says it could launch an intercontinental ballistic missile "at any time," even as Pyongyang appeared to offer Donald Trump an avenue for future talks.

content.$t: month: 1, day: 12, headline: US says it will shoot down any North Korean missile that poses a 'threat', text: US Defense Secretary Ash Carter says that if launches do not pose a risk to the US or an ally, "it may be more to our advantage... to gather intelligence from the flight.", media: http://i2.cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160209172454-02-north-korea-rocket-debris-0902-exlarge-169.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: US says it will shoot down any North Korean missile that poses a 'threat'

gsx$text.$t: US Defense Secretary Ash Carter says that if launches do not pose a risk to the US or an ally, "it may be more to our advantage... to gather intelligence from the flight."

content.$t: month: 1, day: 19, headline: North Korea readies long-range missiles on mobile launchers, text: North Korea may be reading two intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) for a test launch in the near future, according to US and South Korean officials., media: http://i.cdn.turner.com/cnn/.e/interactive/html5-video-media/2016/07/13/North_Korea_missiles_medium.png, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: North Korea readies long-range missiles on mobile launchers

gsx$text.$t: North Korea may be reading two intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) for a test launch in the near future, according to US and South Korean officials.

content.$t: month: 2, day: 2, headline: 'Only N. Korea need fear missile defense', text: "THAAD is for defense of our allies' people ... were it not for the provocative behavior of North Korea we would have no need for THAAD out here," US Defence Sec Mattis says., media: http://i2.cdn.cnn.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160207154336-thaad-missile-defense-exlarge-169.jpg, background: http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2015/images/12/15/north-korea-flag2.jpg

gsx$headline.$t: 'Only N. Korea need fear missile defense'

gsx$text.$t: "THAAD is for defense of our allies' people ... were it not for the provocative behavior of North Korea we would have no need for THAAD out here," US Defence Sec Mattis says.
